claim: All of the 2008 Summer Olympics women could find a hookup athlete partner.

supporting.text: The 2008 Summer Olympics had a large number of participating athletes, increasing the likelihood of mutual attraction and potential hookups.

attacks.text: The 2008 Summer Olympics had a large number of participating athletes, increasing the likelihood of mutual attraction and potential hookups.
Not all athletes may be interested in hookups due to personal, cultural, or professional reasons.
The Olympics environment is highly competitive and regulated, leaving little time or opportunity for social interactions.
Athletes may be in committed relationships or have restrictions from their teams regarding personal interactions.
The claim assumes mutual attraction, which is subjective and not guaranteed among all participants.

supporting.text: Athletes at the Olympics often form close bonds due to shared experiences, which could facilitate finding a hookup partner.

attacks.text: Athletes at the Olympics often form close bonds due to shared experiences, which could facilitate finding a hookup partner.

The claim assumes universal opportunity, but logistical constraints like training schedules and housing arrangements may limit interactions.

supporting.text: Cultural and personal differences among athletes may make it unlikely that all women could find a compatible hookup partner.

supporting.text: The competitive and high-pressure environment of the Olympics might leave little time or energy for forming hookup relationships.

attacks.text: The competitive and high-pressure environment of the Olympics might leave little time or energy for forming hookup relationships.
